gurmukhi: ibrKY bieAwr lwgY jYsy hihrwiq pwiq pMCI n DIrj kir Taur Thrwq hY
transliteration: Birakhai Baiaar Laagai Jaisay Hahiraati Paati , Panchhee N Dheeraj Kari Tthaur Tthaharaat Hai ?
translation: Just as the leaves and branches of a tree start trembling under the influence of fast wind and even the birds lose trust of their nests;

gurmukhi: srvr Gwm lwgY bwrj iblK muK pRwn AMq hMq jl jMq Akulwq hY
transliteration: Saravar Ghaam Laagai Baaraj Bilakh Moukha , Praan Ant Hant Jal Jant Akulaat Hai ?
translation: Just as lotus flowers whither away under the sharp heat of the Sun and aquatic life of the water feels distressed as if their lives were coming to an end;

gurmukhi: swrdUl dyKY miRgmwl sukicq bn vws mY n qRws kir AwsRm suhwq hY
transliteration: Saaradool Daykhai Mrigamaal Soukachit Bana , Vaas Mai N Traas Kari Aasram Suhaat Hai ?
translation: Just as the herd of deers find solace and safety in their small hiding places in the jungle when they see the lion in the vicinity;

gurmukhi: qYsy gur AwNg s√çwNig Bey bY ckiq isK duKiq audws bws Aiq ibllwq hY ]402]
transliteration: Taisay Gur Aang Svaangi Bhaay Bai Chakati Sikha , Doukhati Udaas Baas Ati Bilalaat Hai ?402?
translation: Similarly, the Sikhs of the Guru are frightened, amazed, distressed and morose seeing the body/limbs of a spurious Guru marked with artificial marks of recognition. Even the Sikhs most close to the Guru feel restless.  (402)
